text: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a functional gastrointestinal disorder by a group of symptoms that usually include abdominal pain, abdominal bloating and changes in bowel movements. These symptoms may happen over a long time, sometimes for years. IBS can affect quality of life and may impact daily life activities. Disorders such as anxiety, major depression, and myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) are common among people with IBS.The cited review is based on sources ranging from 1988 to 2001 and is probably biased relative to a more recent research. The cause of IBS is not known, but it can be triggered by stress, or an intestinal infection. ==Notes== ==References== Category:Diseases and disorders of the digestive system
title: Irritable bowel syndrome
